reviewText: I don't know who's responsible for the ridiculous titles for Pallardy's films, but this is the best one of his films I've seen yet. So we'll forgive him for the Python-esque title, and concern ourselves with the trousersnake succubi that permeate this bawdy sex comedy that has copious amounts of nudity every 4 or 5 minutes supplied by some of the finest Eurobabes that have ever come down the Alps. One gorgeous trollop after another, prancing around undraped alone or in droves, this is one of only a handful of sex comedies that's really worth your time and attention. You'll need a female lumberjack to chop down your 'wood' when you're done with this one...
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Le journal erotique d'un bcheron" ("Erotic Diary of a Lumberjack") AKA (new title "La foret aux mille desirs", "The Forest of a Thousand Desires") from 1974. This film by the prolific do-it-yourself Jean-Marie Pallardy (writer/producer/director/actor) French filmmaker of erotica, was a call to return back to nature (they took Rousseau literally). It featured a lot of lovely ladies in their lovely and natural state! This lumberjack was more of a woodpecker! The campiness of it all, was to make sure it didn't play like straightfoward porn. While there was plenty of copious nudity from the ladies, the slow pacing and editing took away from the overall entertainment value. I think this is a sanitized version of the triple xxx original, I may be wrong but I remember seeing this one way back on VHS. It's still an interesting relic to own. Keep an eye out for Claudine Beccarie she did dozens of films like this one in the 70's. The DVD picture quality by Le Chat Qui Fum was very good. NTSC, English (dubbed), extras, NR 94 mins.Love and Peace,Carlos Romero
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm sure that for it's specific genre--French erotica of the 1970s--this is a great production. However I'm judging it in a broader context, that being soft-core pornography in general.And it does have copious female nudity, which is great, and somewhat surprisingly REALLY attractive women which in my experiences generally is not the case for erotica of the '70s. But this really isn't as explicit as some other releases of the era and that's what makes me rate it as three stars rather than four.That would have been very cut-and-dry except that there are several deleted scenes included in the bonus features that are significantly more explicit. Those along with a really nice photo gallery (I don't know about you, but to me the photo galleries attached to movie DVDs almost always are throw-away features--not in this case, check it out!) made me seriously consider giving this four stars, but instead I settled on three (or really three and a half).Oh, and I agree with the other reviewer: the title makes absolutely no sense. There is no lumberjack! Only a professor who decides to leave his life and try to build a utopian sex society in the woods. Yeah, none of it really makes sense...just watch it for the chicks.

reviewText: great looking women, simulated sex. if you are like me, you hope for some camera slip-ups. you know, where you accidentally see something you are not supposed to see..that is the draw of all exploitation films. this video was ok, but nothing to keep. the plot was nonsense. the action was leaving you wanting you more, this could have been a great porn film..but it is only soft core
